item.title: Take My Time
item.content:encoded:
Chess.com Analysis Board

Took my time, and really rocked this guy with a quality checkmate. I really liked how my light-squared bishop covered everything for a while, allowing me to move my knight into attack and open up my queen for the final checkmate. I finished the game with about 1 minute on the clock.

item.title: Chasing the King
item.description: Chased the king around the board and ended up walking him into a MATE!
item.content:encoded: In this game, I kept my cool as the opponent was trying to infiltrate with his queen. I ended up chasing his king around and winning!

item.title: I Got Murdered
item.description: Brutal loss I suffered, and what I learned from it
item.content:encoded: This was a tough game. I got murdered by my opponent. This is called the Wayward Queen Attack, and to defend it I had to play Nc6 then g6. This forces the queen back, and then if the queen goes back to e3, I play Nf6.

item.title: Playing Solid Chess 2
item.content:encoded: Another incredibly solid game. Did hang a few pawns, but completely destroyed my opponent.

item.title: Playing Solid Chess
item.content:encoded: I'm proud of the fact that I played a really solid game. I kept waiting and waiting, and then my opponent moved a bishop protecting the queen and promptly blundered the queen. After taking his queen, he resigned!

item.title: Stomping
item.description: I really liked the checkmate I had on this guy.

item.title: 10 Minute vs. measmyself
item.description: Great game I played where I gobbled up all of his pieces
item.content:encoded:
Here is a great game I played recently at around 500! I'm white, opponent is black.

I am proud of the move 26 Bishop E5. This moved allowed me to check the Black King, and collect a rook. This move had a discovered check, which then allowed me to take the other rook without losing my bishop. After collecting both rooks and threatening the knight on b4, my opponent resigned.
